title: Expected all tensors to be on the same device, but found at least two devices, cuda:0 and cpu!
body:
Hi,

I customized the code to train my 4 classes. 
I have modified coco.names files to my 4 classes, and have update coco2017.data to point to my image list. I have also modified classes=4 for each yolo layer in yolov3.cfg file.

during the training, I am experiencing the following issue:
```Python
Traceback (most recent call last):
  File "C:\Program Files\JetBrains\PyCharm Community Edition 2020.3.1\plugins\python-ce\helpers\pydev\pydevd.py", line 1477, in _exec
    pydev_imports.execfile(file, globals, locals)  # execute the script
  File "C:\Program Files\JetBrains\PyCharm Community Edition 2020.3.1\plugins\python-ce\helpers\pydev\_pydev_imps\_pydev_execfile.py", line 18, in execfile
    exec(compile(contents+"\n", file, 'exec'), glob, loc)
  File "D:/code_python/har_hailiang/ultralytics_yolov3_mine/train.py", line 445, in <module>
    train(hyp)  # train normally
  File "D:/code_python/har_hailiang/ultralytics_yolov3_mine/train.py", line 293, in train
    pred = model(imgs)
  File "C:\ProgramData\Anaconda3\lib\site-packages\torch\nn\modules\module.py", line 727, in _call_impl
    result = self.forward(*input, **kwargs)
  File "D:\code_python\har_hailiang\ultralytics_yolov3_mine\models.py", line 256, in forward
    return self.forward_once(x)
  File "D:\code_python\har_hailiang\ultralytics_yolov3_mine\models.py", line 310, in forward_once
    x = module(x)
  File "C:\ProgramData\Anaconda3\lib\site-packages\torch\nn\modules\module.py", line 727, in _call_impl
    result = self.forward(*input, **kwargs)
  File "C:\ProgramData\Anaconda3\lib\site-packages\torch\nn\modules\container.py", line 117, in forward
    input = module(input)
  File "C:\ProgramData\Anaconda3\lib\site-packages\torch\nn\modules\module.py", line 731, in _call_impl
    hook_result = hook(self, input, result)
  File "C:\ProgramData\Anaconda3\lib\site-packages\thop\vision\basic_hooks.py", line 31, in count_convNd
    m.total_ops += torch.DoubleTensor([int(total_ops)])
RuntimeError: Expected all tensors to be on the same device, but found at least two devices, cuda:0 and cpu!

```

I only modified the classes name and number, why am I facing the issue of tensor in GPU and CPU?
I have also checked the input x and y to the network, and they are both in GPU(cuda:0).

is there any good method to trace the issue?

Thanks and Best Regards,
Ardeal
